rComments: Unable to answer many of our questions during lecture.  Favors the suck-ups (look at her "knock my socks off" to see who they were for each quarter).  Gives too few math problems in lecture, despite those questions making up the majority of exams.  Tries to hard to be hip and funny.  Please avoid having a class with her at all costs

Stephanie is so sweet! Very responsive to student feedback and puts a lot of effort into making her lectures interesting, also very helpful during office hours. Hard class but if you give it your all you can get an A. I would definitely take another class with her

Nice professor that tries her best to make a topic that isn't our major enjoyable. Very approachable at office hours, cool lectures with awesome demos. A very standard class, but you can get a lot out if you put in some effort and study.

SHE IS AWESOME! All of her exams are 2 parts: Multiple Choice and Free Response. MC questions are based on concepts taught in lecture. You go to lecture and pay attention you'll do amazing. Free Response questions are taken straight from the textbook questions at the end. She is an amazing and caring professor and I wish I could have her again.

This class was one of the hardest I've taken on campus, but it was also one of the most interesting. Dr. Bailey is super open to questions and puts a lot of effort into making her lectures understandable-- also just a really friendly proff. (Plus her demos were awesoooome.) You have to really work for an A, but  she wants you to succeed if you try

Dr. Bailey is really sweet, but physics of energy is clearly not her field of expertise. she admitted to googling things prior to lectures and often read straight off her slides. she also had no control over the class and allowed a lot of sidetracking and time-wasting.  her homework is very easy as is the class in general.

Literally a walking train wreck. She is a very conceptually test giver but doesn't go over any conceptual material clearly in class. Even office hours were useless because she would just say "oh um...I don't know". Avoid her if possible. I wish Steinacker wasn't leaving. Very unexperienced and all her questions are copy pasted from the internet.

In the beginning her lectures were very long & she over explains EVERYTHING to the point where I'm more confused. I asked her about changing due dates she got super defensive, she blamed students for having trouble in class, when we asked for more expls in lec she said it wud come at expense of material which we'd have to learn ourselves for finals

Lectures are taken out of textbook.  Gives way too few examples of math-like problems and justifies this by saying, "An understanding of concepts is needed to solve the math problems" Hahaha, no.  Does not answer email b/c "she is too busy" and makes you email the TA for anything.  Her insecurity of not wanting 2 b a pushover makes class irritating
She is very friendly and understanding. Kinda cute too.
She is a great professor and keeps the class interesting. She really cares about her students and will help you if you ask. Physics6B was very enjoyable with her! I highly recommend!

Stephanie was very understanding and adaptive to the students' needs. Her lectures were slow but very helpful for tests and homework. Tests were certainly a little long for my liking but it was similar to some homework problems. She is very funny and I honestly think that she taught this class perfectly. HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED:)

It was Professor Bailey's first time teaching here and I'd say she did a fantastic job. She is extremely receptive to the students and gives fair tests. She's also very fun to listen to in lecture. I hate physics but she made it worth it. I hope she never changes.
